name: Narrator
description: Her voice flows with the warm assurance of a middle-aged British woman who has found her narrative stride—confident and articulate, with crisp enunciation that draws listeners into whatever world she's painting with words.

name: Ebenezer Scrooge
description: He speaks with a weathered, grating British voice that cuts like winter frost—initially sharp and caustic with miserly precision, then cracking with the tremulous emotion of an elderly soul transformed, oscillating between breathless joy and penitent tears.

name: Ghost of Christmas Past
description: His voice emerges as a gentle whisper from across time itself—a low, soft British murmur that carries the mysterious weight of countless witnessed memories, steady and grounded yet distant as moonlight on water. The knowing tone resonates with quiet authority, each word delivered with the assured confidence of one who understands the patterns of human hearts.

name: Jacob Marley's Ghost
description: He speaks in a haunting British timbre, his voice hollow and crackling with ages of torment—stern yet anguished, each mournful word reverberates like chains dragging across stone, carrying the gravelly weight of eternal regret and desperate warning.
visual_attributes: kerchief bound around head and chin

name: Ghost of Christmas Present
description: His voice is a rich, booming instrument with a warm British accent, bursting with exclamatory joy and generous laughter, yet capable of shifting to stern, rebuking tones that command attention—the assured, resonant sound of a middle-aged guide who balances merriment with moral authority.

name: Mrs. Cratchit
description: She speaks with a steady, maternal British accent that carries the grounded warmth of middle-aged womanhood holding her household together through loving determination, though her voice shifts between anxious worry, fierce pride, and sharp indignation depending on whether she's fretting over dinner, celebrating her children, or defending her family's honor.

name: Bob Cratchit
description: He speaks with a meek, tremulous British voice that wavers between humble gratitude and barely-contained emotion—a middle-aged man whose gentle, respectful tone carries the weight of hardship softened by an almost desperate cheerfulness and paternal devotion.
voice_attributes: tremulous when speaking of Tiny Tim

name: Fred
description: He speaks with a bright, welcoming warmth and a lively British accent, each phrase infused with such genuine good cheer and buoyant energy that it seems to glow with infectious optimism.

name: Charwoman
description: Her voice is steady and sharp-edged with a middle-aged British accent, every word delivered with brazen confidence and a callous edge that suggests years of hard work have stripped away any softness or shame. She speaks with the bold, laughing defiance of a woman who knows society's rules but chooses to mock them openly.

name: Charity Collector One
description: He is a middle-aged gentleman with a warm, resonant British voice that flows with practiced politeness and earnest conviction, each word rounded and pleasant like his portly frame, carrying both genuine warmth and the rehearsed grace of someone accustomed to making charitable appeals.

name: Fred
description: He speaks with the buoyant energy of a young British gentleman whose voice seems perpetually on the verge of laughter, warm and inviting as a crackling hearth fire. His optimistic delivery flows with such genuine enthusiasm that every sentence feels like an embrace, forgiving and filled with infectious merriment.

name: Belle
description: She possesses a soft, melancholic British voice—youthful and fair but shadowed by resignation, her gentle tones occasionally hardening into quiet firmness like a dove that has learned it must survive the winter alone.

name: Old Joe
description: His voice crackles with the weight of nearly seven decades, raspy and worn as ancient parchment, carrying the cynical, merchant-like cadence of a British fence who measures every syllable as carefully as he weighs stolen silver.

name: Young Ebenezer Scrooge
description: His voice carries a youthful British tenor edged with frost and impatience, snapping out words in a defensive, calculating manner that reveals a man in his prime who has already traded warmth for wealth.

name: Boy in Sunday Clothes
description: His voice is a clear, bright British tone full of wondering energy and cheerful optimism, carrying that distinctive quality of youthful eagerness that makes every statement sound like a question waiting to be answered.

name: Peter Cratchit
description: The speaker is a spirited young man with a lively British accent, his voice full of boyish pride and enthusiasm that makes him sound perpetually on the verge of a grin, eager to share every observation with animated delight.

name: Fat Businessman
description: His middle-aged British accent flows with a steady, assured timbre that's undercut by profound apathy, each word delivered in a casual, yawning monotone that suggests perpetual boredom with the world's predictable transactions.

name: Old Fezziwig
description: The speaker is an elderly British gentleman whose voice resonates with jovial warmth and comfortable richness, each word tumbling forth with such enthusiastic energy and oily smoothness that his speech seems to laugh all on its own, weathered by time yet refusing to surrender its vigorous, generous spirit.

name: Fred's Wife
description: She speaks with a bright and animated youthful British accent that moves fluidly from startled exclamations to melodious laughter, each word colored by genuine feeling and a provoking charm that matches her dimpled smile.

name: Caroline's Husband
description: He speaks with a British accent that sounds perpetually apologetic and defeated, his youthful voice made hollow by the weight of debt and family responsibility. There's a conflicted quality to his speech—moments of embarrassment breaking through depressed monotones, punctuated by rare exhales of relief.

name: Caroline
description: She is a young British woman whose voice flutters with maternal anxiety, soft and mild yet threaded through with nervous tension that occasionally gives way to breathy, heartfelt expressions of gratitude and relief.

name: Mrs. Dilber
description: She speaks with a middle-aged British accent that is brisk and jittery, punctuated by anxious giggles that betray her complicity in wrongdoing. Her tone shifts rapidly between hushed, secretive murmurs and sharp bursts of nervous merriment, like a kettle perpetually about to whistle.

name: Fan
description: Her voice rings out bright and clear with a British lilt, pitched high and musical with the pure, unfiltered enthusiasm that radiates from every syllable like sunshine through a windowpane. There's a gleeful quality to her speech, as though every sentence might dissolve into delighted laughter.

name: Young Ebenezer Scrooge
description: The speaker is a melancholy young soul with a soft British accent that wavers between loneliness and sudden bright enthusiasm when speaking of beloved stories, his voice carrying the fragile hopefulness of one accustomed to solitude.

name: Belle's Husband
description: His voice carries the warm, steady timbre of a contented middle-aged British father, gentle and reassuring with an unmistakable undercurrent of domestic happiness that makes every word feel like an embrace.

name: Bob Cratchit
description: This middle-aged man's voice wavers with nervous deference, his British accent marked by a meek, almost breathless quality that suggests constant apprehension. His tone is humble and apologetic, the vocal equivalent of a bow, trembling slightly as though each utterance requires permission.

name: First Wealthy Man
description: His voice is resonant and assured with a crisp British accent, though the warmth one might expect is replaced by an icy indifference—he speaks as if perpetually bored by those beneath his station, his steady middle-aged cadence unhurried and utterly unconcerned with the impact of his words.

name: Second Wealthy Man
description: He delivers his words in a smooth, authoritative British accent polished by middle-aged success, but his tone remains glacially indifferent, like a banker declining a loan without a flicker of concern. The resonant quality of his voice suggests command and experience, yet every phrase lands with calculating coldness that maintains absolute emotional distance.

name: Belle
description: She speaks with a warm, resonant British accent that carries the steady confidence of middle age, her voice rich with contentment and frequently brightened by genuine laughter that seems to bubble up naturally from deep satisfaction with her life.

name: Cratchit Daughter
description: Her voice is a delicate British lilt, youthful yet tinged with feeling, rising and falling like a nostalgic melody when she speaks of precious times past. The emotional catch in her throat reveals a heart easily moved to both joy and sorrow, speaking with the genuine sweetness of devoted affection.

name: Fred's Wife's Sister
aliases: the plump one with the lace tucker
description: Her voice is youthful and warm with a genteel British lilt, constantly dancing between mock indignation and genuine mirth, each syllable colored by the rosy blush that seems audible in her tone—light, musical, and irresistibly good-humored.

name: Martha Cratchit
description: She speaks with a weary British lilt, her voice gentle and warm despite the fatigue that softens its edges—each word carrying both the dutiful responsibility of an eldest daughter and the tender affection of a young woman who still finds strength to care for others.

name: Red-Faced Gentleman
description: He speaks with a calculating, middle-aged British businessman's tone—resonant and assured yet coarsened by crude appetites and mercenary instincts—each phrase delivered with the blunt directness of a merchant who sees every conversation as a transaction to be won.

name: Servant Girl
description: She speaks with a soft, pleasant British accent that carries the gentle deference of domestic service, her polite tone warm and attentive like freshly brewed tea offered on a silver tray.

name: Young Cratchit Boy
description: He speaks with a bright, treble British accent that frequently crescendos into ecstatic shouts, brimming with the unbridled exuberance of youth. Every word seems to vibrate with barely-contained energy, as if he's perpetually on the verge of bursting with enthusiasm.

name: Second Businessman
description: His voice is warm and approachable with a clear British accent, resonant with the measured confidence of middle age while maintaining an informal, inquisitive quality that sounds like someone who's done enough business to be relaxed about it, but remains genuinely interested in what comes next.

name: Third Businessman
description: His voice carries the assured resonance of a middle-aged merchant, punctuated by frequent pauses for snuff-taking, with an inquisitive lilt that turns even statements into gentle queries in his proper British accent.

name: Carol Singer
description: The speaker is a spirited young man with a melodious British accent that carries the cheerful brightness of holiday cheer, his voice clear and resonant with youthful energy that seems to turn every phrase into a musical note.

name: Charity Collector Two
description: His voice flows with the assured pleasantness of a middle-aged British gentleman, resonant and warm like well-polished wood, each word carefully chosen with both politeness and a keen observational eye for human nature. The timbre is grounded and confident, neither rushed nor hesitant, belonging to someone who has learned the art of civil persuasion.

name: Tiny Tim
description: He speaks with a gentle British accent that emerges soft and sweet as a church bell heard from afar, plaintive and thoughtful in its cadence, yet weakened as though each word requires precious effort to form.

name: Topper
description: His voice is a rich, growling bass with a British lilt, carrying the warm depth of a cello's low notes as he speaks with the playful confidence of a charming young bachelor on the hunt for romance.
